newsitem.title: USA: PacifiCorp already helping Big River sales.
newsitem.headline: PacifiCorp already helping Big River sales.

text.p: PacifiCorp is working with Big Rivers Electric Corp to sell the utility's surplus power into the eastern power markets, Big Rivers said Wednesday.

Commenting on PacifiCorp's agreement to operate Big River's power plants if its bankruptcy proposal is approved, chief executive Michael Core said "Western Kentucky is already seeing benefits of this agreement because of the interim marketing and economic development agreements Big Rivers and PacifiCorp have signed."
Power sales under the interim agreement are increasing the use of the power plants, fueled by western Kentucky coal.
Big Rivers said it burned an additional 130,000 tons of coal during the first nine months of the agreement in 1996.

Core said he was also pleased that the bankruptcy proceeding has allowed Big Rivers to bring all its coal purchase contracts to market prices, resulting in savings of $165 million and removing a major obstacle to the PacifiCorp lease and operating transaction.
Big River spokeswoman Susan Sauls said an agreement has been reached with Costain Coal while talks continue with Green River Coal.
She said the aluminum smelters which have agreed to new competitive rates, under contracts which run until 2010, are Southwire's Hawesville, Ky., plant and Alcan Aluminum Ltd's Sebree plant.
Sauls said the New York banks that will pay Big Rivers to be released from letters of credit obligations are Bank of New York Co Inc and Chase Manhattan Corp.
She said the company is due to return to court on February 19 to report on the status of its coal talks and preparation of a rate case filing.

Big River's power plants are the 480 megawatt Coleman Station at Hawesville; the 440 megawatt D.B. Wilson Station at Island, Ky.; and the 482 megawatt Green Station and 66 megawatt Reid Station, both at Sebree.
These plants are 100 percent owned and coal fired, Sauls said. She said the company also operates the City of Henderson's Station Two. ((-- Jim Brumm 212-859-1710.))
